span.style: font-size:18; font-family:Comic Sans MS; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#550000
font-size:14; font-family:微软雅黑; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#000000

item.answer:
【考法 1】 v. 妥协：to adjust or settle by mutual共同的；相互的，彼此的 concessions 让步；特许（权）；承认；退位
【例】Eventually we reached a compromise on the number of hours per week
【近】accommodation, negotiation
【考法 2】 v. 使危险：to place in danger
【例】Officials were concerned that his statements would compromise national security.
【近】hazard, imperil, jeopardy, jeopardize, menace, peril, venture
【记】 promise许诺
